trans-unit.source: Step 5: Create a WCF Client
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Create a WCF Client

trans-unit.source: Step 5: Create a WCF Client for the Service Contract
trans-unit.target: Step 5: Create a WCF Client for the Service Contract

trans-unit.source: This is the fifth of seven tasks required to create a basic <token>sb2</token> service and a client application that can call the service.
trans-unit.target: This is the fifth of seven tasks required to create a basic <token>sb2</token> service and a client application that can call the service.

trans-unit.source: For an overview of all seven tasks, see <link xlink:href="24332c3c-277f-46f2-949a-d4381b8bfb0b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">AppFabric Service Bus Tutorial</link>.
trans-unit.target: For an overview of all seven tasks, see <link xlink:href="24332c3c-277f-46f2-949a-d4381b8bfb0b" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">AppFabric Service Bus Tutorial</link>.

trans-unit.source: This topic describes how to create a basic <token>sb2</token> client application and define the service contract you will be implementing in later steps.
trans-unit.target: This topic describes how to create a basic <token>sb2</token> client application and define the service contract you will be implementing in later steps.

trans-unit.source: Note that many of these steps resemble the steps used to create a service: defining a contract, editing an App.config file, using credentials to connect to <token>sb2</token>, and so on.
trans-unit.target: Note that many of these steps resemble the steps used to create a service: defining a contract, editing an App.config file, using credentials to connect to <token>sb2</token>, and so on.

trans-unit.source: The code used for these tasks is provided in the example following the procedure.
trans-unit.target: The code used for these tasks is provided in the example following the procedure.

trans-unit.source: For the purposes of this tutorial, both the client and the service run on the same network and computer.
trans-unit.target: For the purposes of this tutorial, both the client and the service run on the same network and computer.

trans-unit.source: However, this is not required.
trans-unit.target: However, this is not required.

trans-unit.source: The advantage of using <token>sb2</token> is to enable applications across network boundaries to seamlessly communicate.
trans-unit.target: The advantage of using <token>sb2</token> is to enable applications across network boundaries to seamlessly communicate.

trans-unit.source: Time to completion: 10 minutes
trans-unit.target: Time to completion: 10 minutes

trans-unit.source: To create the Service Bus client application
trans-unit.target: To create the Service Bus client application

trans-unit.source: Create a new project in the current <token>vs_current_short</token> solution for the client by doing the following:
trans-unit.target: Create a new project in the current <token>vs_current_short</token> solution for the client by doing the following:

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, in the same solution that contains the service, right-click the current solution (not the project), and select <ui>Add</ui>.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, in the same solution that contains the service, right-click the current solution (not the project), and select <ui>Add</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Then click <ui>New Project</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Then click <ui>New Project</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In the <ui>Add New Project</ui> dialog, click <ui>Visual C#</ui> (if <ui>Visual C#</ui> does not appear, look under <ui>Other Languages</ui>), select the <ui>Console Application</ui> template, and name it <userInput>EchoClient</userInput>.
trans-unit.target: In the <ui>Add New Project</ui> dialog, click <ui>Visual C#</ui> (if <ui>Visual C#</ui> does not appear, look under <ui>Other Languages</ui>), select the <ui>Console Application</ui> template, and name it <userInput>EchoClient</userInput>.

trans-unit.source: Click <ui>OK</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Click <ui>OK</ui>.

trans-unit.source: In <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, double-click the Program.cs file in the <ui>EchoClient</ui> project to open it in the editor.
trans-unit.target: In <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>, double-click the Program.cs file in the <ui>EchoClient</ui> project to open it in the editor.

trans-unit.source: Change the namespace name from its default name of <codeInline>EchoClient</codeInline> to <codeInline>Microsoft.ServiceBus.Samples</codeInline>.
trans-unit.target: Change the namespace name from its default name of <codeInline>EchoClient</codeInline> to <codeInline>Microsoft.ServiceBus.Samples</codeInline>.

trans-unit.source: Add a reference to System.ServiceModel.dll for the project:
trans-unit.target: Add a reference to System.ServiceModel.dll for the project:

trans-unit.source: Right-click <ui>References</ui> under the <ui>EchoClient</ui> project in <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Right-click <ui>References</ui> under the <ui>EchoClient</ui> project in <ui>Solution Explorer</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Then click <ui>Add Reference</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Then click <ui>Add Reference</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Because you already added a reference to this assembly in the first step of this tutorial, it is now listed in the <ui>Recent</ui> tab.
trans-unit.target: Because you already added a reference to this assembly in the first step of this tutorial, it is now listed in the <ui>Recent</ui> tab.

trans-unit.source: Click the <ui>Recent</ui> tab, select <ui>System.ServiceModel.dll</ui> from the list.
trans-unit.target: Click the <ui>Recent</ui> tab, select <ui>System.ServiceModel.dll</ui> from the list.

trans-unit.source: Then click <ui>OK</ui>.
trans-unit.target: Then click <ui>OK</ui>.

trans-unit.source: If you do not see <ui>System.ServiceModel.dll</ui> in the <ui>Recent</ui> tab, click the <ui>Browse</ui> tab and move to <ui>C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v3.0\Windows Communication Foundation</ui>.
trans-unit.target: If you do not see <ui>System.ServiceModel.dll</ui> in the <ui>Recent</ui> tab, click the <ui>Browse</ui> tab and move to <ui>C:\Windows\Microsoft.NET\Framework\v3.0\Windows Communication Foundation</ui>.

trans-unit.source: Then select the assembly from there.
trans-unit.target: Then select the assembly from there.

trans-unit.source: Add a <codeInline>using</codeInline> statement for the <codeEntityReference>N:System.ServiceModel</codeEntityReference> namespace in the Program.cs file.
trans-unit.target: Add a <codeInline>using</codeInline> statement for the <codeEntityReference>N:System.ServiceModel</codeEntityReference> namespace in the Program.cs file.

trans-unit.source: Repeat steps two and three to add a reference to the Microsoft.ServiceBus.dll and <codeEntityReference>N:Microsoft.ServiceBus</codeEntityReference> namespace to your project.
trans-unit.target: Repeat steps two and three to add a reference to the Microsoft.ServiceBus.dll and <codeEntityReference>N:Microsoft.ServiceBus</codeEntityReference> namespace to your project.

trans-unit.source: Add the service contract definition to the namespace, as shown in the following example.
trans-unit.target: Add the service contract definition to the namespace, as shown in the following example.

trans-unit.source: Note that this definition is identical to the definition used in the <ui>Service</ui> project.
trans-unit.target: Note that this definition is identical to the definition used in the <ui>Service</ui> project.

trans-unit.source: You should add this code at the top of the <codeInline>Microsoft.ServiceBus.Samples</codeInline> namespace.
trans-unit.target: You should add this code at the top of the <codeInline>Microsoft.ServiceBus.Samples</codeInline> namespace.

trans-unit.source: Press <embeddedLabel>F6</embeddedLabel> to build the client.
trans-unit.target: Press <embeddedLabel>F6</embeddedLabel> to build the client.

trans-unit.source: The following code shows the current status of the Program.cs file in the <ui>EchoClient</ui> project.
trans-unit.target: The following code shows the current status of the Program.cs file in the <ui>EchoClient</ui> project.

trans-unit.source: Now that the interface is created, proceed to <link xlink:href="adc7ac40-5322-4a16-927f-d3b489fc4ac7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 6: Configure an AppFabric Service Bus Client</link> to implement the interface.
trans-unit.target: Now that the interface is created, proceed to <link xlink:href="adc7ac40-5322-4a16-927f-d3b489fc4ac7" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink">Step 6: Configure an AppFabric Service Bus Client</link> to implement the interface.
